column4: can anyone tell me what to look under to get ndiswrapper in synaptic?
ndiswrapper-utils
just sudo apt-get install ndiswrapper-utils
ndiswrapper -i <file>
you trying to get a wireless card running?
I recommend heavy googling, to be honest.  what kind of cardd?
do you need both?
I was you I'd just lose the usb one
yeah so i'd ditch the usb one.  what kind of card is the pci?
and are you sure there's no native driver for it?
try iwconfig
nothing?
linksys wmp11 ver 2.7 is how it identifies in lspci?
that should tell you what chipset it's got
yeh, just look for network controller
lspci | grep -i net
was afraid of that.  :\
broadcoms notorious for being a pain in the backside.  that's what mine is.
slightly different chipset tho
hrm.  I almost just wentout and bought a new card, then I'd have had to find out.  got mine working though so i haven't checked into it
well you might be able to get yours to work too.  it just probably won't be easy
